title: pn5673
author: pn5673
content: Hello everyone! In the last years gambling livestreams (mainly on Twitch) as well as gambling videos on YouTube gained more and more popularity. For my thesis I am looking for exactly such people who like to watch gambling livestreams.If you watch livestreams where slots or other casino games are played, you are a very big help to me!Would also love to hear your opinion on gambling livestreams below this post!Â The survey takes about 10-12 min and can be answered in English or German. https://limesurvey.allgpsy.uni-due.de/index.php?r=survey/index&sid=195442&lang=enÂ I am very grateful to share my study here! For the people who are interested there is definitely a summary of the results. Thanks a lot and all the best! Paul

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Hello and welcome to the forum.If you are looking for gamblers to collect such information then you are in the right place and I am sure many folks around here would be glad to help you out, however, be aware that also there are people here who use and store cryptocurrency and important credentials on their computersÂ  to gamble in a daily basis and some will be extra wary when comes to clicking on any link they do not recognize. At least, that is my position when I browse the forum.Anyways, I wish you good luck with your thesis.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: The research I conducted for a gambling website showed that there are three primary reasons why people like to watch gambling livestreams. That is, there is a casual fan, who likes the idea of gambling but doesn't gamble himself. There are gamblers themselves, who enjoy watching other people gamble and they want to learn strategies and tactics. Finally, there is the group of hardcore fans, which watches every stream in order to support streamers and be part of the community. Even though some people might think that livestreams are overhyped in the gaming world and that it is a dead trend, watching other people gamble just for entertainment still has a lot of potential. Most importantly, it is unlikely that this kind of content will go out of style, as people like to watch others and learn from them. Most of these fans are learning the gambling techniques by watching streamers and then practicing it themselves on gambling sites.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on November 03, 2022, 10:39:34 PMThe research I conducted for a gambling website showed that there are three primary reasons why people like to watch gambling livestreams. That is, there is a casual fan, who likes the idea of gambling but doesn't gamble himself. There are gamblers themselves, who enjoy watching other people gamble and they want to learn strategies and tactics. Finally, there is the group of hardcore fans, which watches every stream in order to support streamers and be part of the community. Your second and third reasons, I think, nailed it. I myself do watch some streamers who are gambling on their streams but I did not search for it. Since I am one of their followers, it pops up on my newsfeed or wall as recommendation by the platform. But to those who are that hooked up with gambling, they are looking for streamers to get idea or strategies they could use whenever they are playing. Out of curiousity I also asked the same question as OP have asked, to my friends who are also moderate gamblers. Majority of them answered no, because they only gamble to kill time, nothing more. But two of them (they're 7 btw), has the same answer with mine ;streams do just pop up out of nowhere which catches their attention.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: I watch some Youtube streams of really popular gamblers only when I find myself completely unmotivated to continue playing slot machines but yet something inside me tells me to keep playing as my moment will come.When I watch these streams that sometimes are usually long I watch all kind of winnings combination as they play with a much higher bet than I do and they tend to get the bonus round much more than I do because they keep playing much longer than I do.I can't help you much you with the thesis as I do not like clicking links especially ones that has the word "lime" making me think of limetorrents web and the word "survey" making me think about all those sites that bombard you with ads just to earn some cents by doing surveys.

comments.author: Saint-loup
comments.body: Quote from: pn5673 on November 03, 2022, 05:18:44 PMHello everyone! In the last years gambling livestreams (mainly on Twitch) as well as gambling videos on YouTube gained more and more popularity. For my thesis I am looking for exactly such people who like to watch gambling livestreams.If you watch livestreams where slots or other casino games are played, you are a very big help to me!Would also love to hear your opinion on gambling livestreams below this post!Â The survey takes about 10-12 min and can be answered in English or German. https://limesurvey.allgpsy.uni-due.de/index.php?r=survey/index&sid=195442&lang=enÂ I am very grateful to share my study here! For the people who are interested there is definitely a summary of the results. Thanks a lot and all the best! PaulYes I watch them from time to time but usually it's only for getting some bonus drops or because the streamer is funny or because the streamer is a sexy girl to be honest. I also watch them when there are giving the results of a tournament, a lottery or a game I've participated in. But watching a man or a woman spinning slots for hours is boring as hell and I don't really understand how people are able to watch that so long.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: I don't often watch gambling streamers only occasionally when I really have free time and don't clash with sports matches which I think are more interesting to watch than gambling streamers who immediately feel bored if I watch it for too long, for example more than 20 minutes. I know many gamblers who really love to watch gambling streamers but I don't much love.

comments.author: PawGo
comments.body: Quote from: pn5673 on November 03, 2022, 05:18:44 PMThe survey takes about 10-12 min and can be answered in English or German. https://limesurvey.allgpsy.uni-due.de/index.php?r=survey/index&sid=195442&lang=enCould you tell us more about your research? For which purpose it is? Is it for your thesis? Personally I always found weird to watch someone else playing/gambling, as a poor substitute to performing the activity itself. But maybe that's what people like to do nowadays - watch other's life - and it could be anything, from playing games to streams with real trading on stock market.

comments.author: panjul07
comments.body: Quote from: PawGo on November 04, 2022, 03:15:59 PMQuote from: pn5673 on November 03, 2022, 05:18:44 PMThe survey takes about 10-12 min and can be answered in English or German. https://limesurvey.allgpsy.uni-due.de/index.php?r=survey/index&sid=195442&lang=enCould you tell us more about your research? For which purpose it is? Is it for your thesis? Personally I always found weird to watch someone else playing/gambling, as a poor substitute to performing the activity itself. But maybe that's what people like to do nowadays - watch other's life - and it could be anything, from playing games to streams with real trading on stock market.I tried to click the survey link and there is an information about the purpose of the survey. The information tells reader that he is a university student who takes subject of General Psychology and yes it is a part of his final thesis. By the way, I do not start the survey, I'm just curious about it and tried to read more by clicking the provided link. For OP, maybe 10-15 minutes of survey sounds so easy but I guess you wont get enough respondents here.

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: I want to ask about "Watching online gambling livestreams." What if someone only watches the live streams occasionally? Is that mean that person should select "Yes"? By the way, I select "Yes," but I do not watch the streaming too often. I do not get any problem gambling and although I lose my money, that does not make me stop gambling on other days. I hope you can give the result of your short survey.

comments.author: Jemzx00
comments.body: Quote from: pn5673 on November 03, 2022, 05:18:44 PMThe survey takes about 10-12 min and can be answered in English or German. https://limesurvey.allgpsy.uni-due.de/index.php?r=survey/index&sid=195442&lang=enI would love to share my insights and answer your survey to at least help you with your study about gambling streams. Unfortunately, it seems like the link is not working on my end as I can't access on both my phone and pc.Anyways, I enjoy watching slot games mainly on YouTube and Facebook streams, as I also feel excited since they bet huge amounts compared to what I bet on the same game. It also thrills me when they are winning huge wins and multiple combos. Â To be honest, I didn't really search for those until they got into my videos while watching games and didn't expect to enjoy almost the same when I gamble myself.

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on November 04, 2022, 01:26:52 PMI watch some Youtube streams of really popular gamblers only when I find myself completely unmotivated to continue playing slot machines but yet something inside me tells me to keep playing as my moment will come.When I watch these streams that sometimes are usually long I watch all kind of winnings combination as they play with a much higher bet than I do and they tend to get the bonus round much more than I do because they keep playing much longer than I do.I can't help you much you with the thesis as I do not like clicking links especially ones that has the word "lime" making me think of limetorrents web and the word "survey" making me think about all those sites that bombard you with ads just to earn some cents by doing surveys.Those YouTube streamings are very Charming; they could push you into something you made a vow to yourself never to try again which, Is exactly what happened to you. it's obvious that those vids are made to stream for certain reformatory purposes; one of which could change your perception of staking low, with valid reasons, supportively on the same motion.Limetorrents hasn't done much damages to me, AFAIK. I dunno why you're scared of getting on that link ðŸ˜‚. If it's a phishing link, it'll noticed quickly, okay - except maybe for the word "survey", with ads that occupies space on data usage statistics.Sandra ðŸ’‡

comments.author: el kaka22
comments.body: Yes and no. I do watch them if there is something huge going on, like some event, something not to miss because there has been stuff where Drake gave out 500k type of events, and I wouldn't want to miss that, maybe I would be the winner of some huge amount? Who knows. But at the same time no, because I do not watch them as a hobby or free time thing, if there is nothing going on, just a regular streamer gambling is not something I would like to watch.There needs to be something I could personally gain from it, that would be a reason why I would watch something like that, otherwise I wouldn't watch it if there is no gain for me in the end and itâ€™s just a streamer having fun by himself.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: I prefer to watch series of videos where gamblers set a goal and try reaching that step by step every new day, instead of watching random lives, so I can watch several videos which were recorded for several days at once.They are also much shorter and go directly to the point, while lives can take hours to end. For me that is a waste of time and I don't sympathize with streamers very much because they don't look natural on their behaviors and seems to be always over-reacting to everything in order to create hype. They treat the audience like kids, what is annoying.

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: Just fill the survery.Good luck for your study, I think everyone is watching a streamer because is a good place for get information game without any spending money. My suggestion for the survey, hoping is only selected since everyone is really lazy to fill a text.GOOD LUCK.

comments.author: ralle14
comments.body: Submitted all my answers for the survey and looking forward to the results once you've gathered enough data.Â  For me, the gambling streams were mostly just background noise whenever I'm doing something else, and sometimes it feels similar to watching a car crash, you know what's going to happen later on but a lot of people still watch and see how it'll unfold.

comments.author: Doell
comments.body: Already fill, I hope my participation in fill out the survey helps your thesis, interesting in survey not just about streams but also about gambling.Yes sometimes I watching streams depending on conditions, when bored with gambling then I watch some streams slots or some poker.

Also, many people don't know that those gamblers are making money while they are streaming live and therefore they have a reason to show themselves live for hours and hours.

comments.author: cryptomaniac_xxx
comments.body: Check the link:Yes, there are times that I just feel like watching gambling streams, I don't know, maybe to refresh myself or to be just entertain seeing those huge bets by the streamers and hoping that I can be that whale in the future.Â  Of course we wanted to see their strategy, but for slots, I guess i will go for that max bet every time and then see how I will fare if I got the bonus spin with that amount of bet.
